message.content:
cs.CR, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.NE 

The paper focuses on designing a multimodal biometric authentication system using EEG and gait signals to better protect against the risk of traditional biometric authentication systems being tricked by biometric tools. This involves the use of machine learning techniques such as attention-based RNN. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves computer vision techniques for gait analysis, which suggests the possibility of cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) being a likely sub-category. Additionally, the use of machine learning techniques for authentication suggests the possibility of cs.LG (Machine Learning) being a likely sub-category. The paper also involves human-computer interaction, which suggests the possibility of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) being a likely sub-category. Finally, the use of EEG signals suggests the possibility of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) being a likely sub-category.
